P078034.project_name: Coral Reef Targeted Research and Capacity Building for Management Project

keywords.cdata: applied research, Biodiversity, Capacity Building, climate change, coastal development, coastal management, Coral, Coral Reef, coral reef management, Coral Reef Symposium, coral reefs, ecosystem, ecosystem change, ecosystems, financial management, fish, Global Environment, graduate degrees, Impact Indicators, information exchange, issues, knowledge products, Learning, mangroves, NGOs, outcome indicators, papers, Performance Indicators, protection, Reef, Research findings, research institutions, researchers, Scientific Knowledge, scientists, species, water resources

project_abstract.cdata: The objective of the Coral Reef Targeted Research and Capacity Building for Management Project is to align, for the first time, the expertise and resources of the global coral reef community around key research questions related to the resilience and vulnerability of coral reef ecosystems, to integrate the results, and to disseminate them in formats readily accessible to managers and decision-makers. The project appraisal document (PAD) states that a related objective is to build much-needed capacity for science-based management of coral reefs in developing countries, where the majority of reefs are found. The changes in this restructuring include a simplification and reordering of the key performance indicators as described in the project appraisal document (PAD) and the project implementation manual.
